noun.description: A book or other written or printed work, regarded in terms of its content rather than its physical form.
examples: a text that explores pain and grief

noun.description: The main body of a book or other piece of writing, as distinct from other material such as notes, appendices, and illustrations.
examples: the pictures are clear and relate well to the text

noun.description: A written work chosen or assigned as a subject of study.
examples: the book is intended as a secondary text for religion courses

noun.description: Fine, large handwriting, used especially for manuscripts.

examples: I thought it was fantastic that he took the trouble to text me
stricter regulations against texting while driving

origin: Late Middle English: from Old Northern French texte, from Latin textus tissue, literary style (in medieval Latin, Gospel), from text- woven, from the verb texere.
